API Reference¶

Classes and functions in ziopcpy package. For tutorial on how to use the package to estimate the ZiOP(C) model, see Tutorial for Estimating ZiOP Model and Tutorial for Estimating ZiOPC Model.

The ziopcpy module¶

Classes and Functions for the ziopcpy module.

class ziopcpy.OpModel(llik, coef, aic, vcov, data, xs, ts, x_, yx_, yncat, xstr, ystr)[source]¶

Store model results from opmod().

class ziopcpy.ZiopModel(llik, coef, aic, vcov, data, xs, zs, ts, x_, yx_, z_, yncat, xstr, ystr, zstr)[source]¶

Store model results from ziopmod().

class ziopcpy.ZiopcModel(llik, coef, aic, vcov, data, xs, zs, ts, x_, yx_, z_, rho, yncat, xstr, ystr, zstr)[source]¶

Store model results from ziopcmod().

class ziopcpy.FittedVals(responsefull, responseordered, responseinflation, linear)[source]¶

Store fitted values for ZiOP/ZiOPC models.

ziopcpy.op(pstart, x, y, data, weights, offsetx)[source]¶

Calculate likelihood function for Ordered Probit Model.

Parameters

  • pstart (numpy.ndarray) – starting parameters.

  • x (pandas.core.frame.DataFrame) – Ordered stage variables.

  • y (pandas.core.frame.DataFrame) –

  • data (pandas.core.frame.DataFrame) – dataset.

  • weights (int) – weights.

  • offsetx (int) – offset for X.

ziopcpy.ziop(pstart, x, y, z, data, weights, offsetx, offsetz)[source]¶

Calculate likelihood function for Zero-inflated Model.

Parameters

  • pstart (numpy.ndarray) – starting parameters.

  • x (pandas.core.frame.DataFrame) – Ordered stage variables.

  • y (pandas.core.frame.DataFrame) –

  • z (pandas.core.frame.DataFrame) – Inflation stage variables.

  • data (pandas.core.frame.DataFrame) – dataset.

  • weights (int) – weights.

  • offsetx (int) – offset for X.

  • offsetz (int) – offset for z.

ziopcpy.ziopc(pstart, x, y, z, data, weights, offsetx, offsetz)[source]¶

Calculate likelihood function for Zero-inflated Correlated-Errors Model.

Parameters

  • pstart (numpy.ndarray) – starting parameters.

  • x (pandas.core.frame.DataFrame) – Ordered stage variables.

  • y (pandas.core.frame.DataFrame) –

  • z (pandas.core.frame.DataFrame) – Inflation stage variables.

  • data (pandas.core.frame.DataFrame) – dataset.

  • weights (int) – weights.

  • offsetx (int) – offset for X.

  • offsetz (int) – offset for z.

Produce estimation results, part of opmod().

Parameters

  • model – model object created from minimization

  • data – dataset

  • x – Ordered stage variables

  • y – : DV

ziopcpy.opmod(pstart, data, x, y, method='BFGS', weights=1, offsetx=0)[source]¶

Estimate Ordered Probit model and return OpModel class object.

Parameters

  • pstart – starting parameters

  • data – full dataset

  • y (list of str) –

  • method – method for optimization, default ‘BFGS’

  • weights – weights

  • offsetx – offset for X

Returns

OpModel

ziopcpy.ziopmod(pstart, data, x, y, z, method='BFGS', weights=1, offsetx=0, offsetz=0)[source]¶

Estimate ZiOP model and return ZiopModel class object as output.

Parameters

  • pstart – starting parameters

  • data – full dataset

  • y (list of str) –

  • z (list of str) – Inflation stage variables.

  • method – method for optimization, default ‘BFGS’

  • weights – weights

  • offsetx – offset for X

  • offsetz – offset for Z

Returns

IopModel

ziopcpy.ziopcmod(pstart, data, x, y, z, method='BFGS', weights=1, offsetx=0, offsetz=0)[source]¶

Estimate ZiOPC model and return ZiopcModel class object as output.

Parameters

  • pstart – starting parameters

  • data – full dataset

  • y (list of str) –

  • z (list of str) – Inflation stage variables.

  • method – method for optimization, default ‘BFGS’

  • weights – weights

  • offsetx – offset for X

  • offsetz – offset for Z

Returns

IopCModel

ziopcpy.vuong_opziop(opmodel, ziopmodel)[source]¶

Run the Vuong test to compare the performance of the OP and ZiOP model.

Parameters

  • opmodel – The OP model from OpModel

  • ziopmodel – The ZiOP model from ZiopModel

Returns

vuongopziop: Result of the Vuong test

ziopcpy.vuong_opziopc(opmodel, ziopcmodel)[source]¶

Run the Vuong test to compare the performance of the OP and ZiOPC model.

Parameters

  • opmodel – The OP model from OpModel

  • ziopcmodel – The ZiOPC model from ZiopcModel

Returns

vuongopziopc: Result of the Vuong test

ziopcpy.split_effects(model, inflvar, nsims=10000)[source]¶

Calculate the changes in probability of being 0 in the split-probit stage.

This function calculate predicted probabilities when there is change in value of a variable in the split-probit equation. The chosen dummy variable is changed from 0 to 1, and chosen numerical variable is mean value + 1 standard deviation. Other variables are kept at 0 or mean value (Note: the current version of the function recognize ordinal variables as numerical).

Parameters

  • model – ZiopModel or ZiopcModel

  • inflvar – int representing the location of variable in the split-probit equation (attribute .inflate of ZiopModel or ZiopcModel)

  • nsims – number of simulated observations, default to 10000

Returns

changeprobs: a dataframe of the predicted probabilities when there is change in the variable (1) versus original values (0).

ziopcpy.ordered_effects(model, ordvar, nsims=10000)[source]¶

Calculate the changes in probability in each outcome in OP stage.

This function calculate predicted probabilities when there is change in value of a variable in the ordered probit equation. The chosen dummy variable is changed from 0 to 1, and chosen numerical variable is mean value + 1 standard deviation. Other variables are kept at 0 or mean value (Note: the current version of the function recognize ordinal variables as numerical).

Parameters

  • model – ZiopModel or ZiopcModel

  • ordvar – int representing the location of variable in the ordered probit equation (attribute .ordered of ZiopModel or ZiopcModel)

  • nsims – number of simulated observations, default to 10000

Returns

changeprobs: a dataframe of the predicted probabilities when there is change in the variable for each outcome (1) versus original values (0).
